name: Pooja Patel
warning_signs: Decreased urine output or dark-colored urine
follow_up_instructions: Report any signs of infection immediately
Attend dialysis sessions as scheduled (3 times per week)
Restrict fluid intake to 1.5 liters per day
Schedule lab work for kidney function tests in 2 weeks
discharge_summary:
Patient Pooja Patel was admitted on 2025-09-24 with Urinary Tract Infection with Complications. 
During hospitalization, patient was managed with Sodium bicarbonate 650mg three times daily, Calcitriol 0.25mcg daily, Metoprolol 50mg twice daily. 
Procedures performed included Peritoneal dialysis catheter insertion, Arteriovenous fistula creation.
Patient's condition improved and was stable at discharge. 
Discharged home with instructions to follow up with nephrologist and continue medications as prescribed. 
Patient educated on warning signs and dietary restrictions.
